action.action-desc: Mr. Kean of New Jersey (for himself, Mr. Pascrell, Mr. Bost, Mr. Golden of Maine, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Hoyer, Mr. Collins, Ms. Stevens, Mr. Lucas, and Ms. Lofgren) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology
Additional sponsors: Ms. Blunt Rochester, Mr. Jackson of North Carolina, Ms. Perez, Mr. Gottheimer, and Mr. Smith of New Jersey
Reported from the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 to authorize appropriations for the United States Fire Administration and firefighter assistance grant programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fire Grants and Safety Act of 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of the United States Fire Administration
section.text: Section 17(g)(1) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2216(g)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (L), by striking and after the semicolon;

subparagraph.text: by striking for for and inserting for; and
by striking the period and inserting ; and; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subparagraraph:

subparagraph.text: $95,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2028, of which $3,420,000 for each such fiscal year shall be used to carry out section 8(f).

section.header: Reauthorization of Assistance to Firefighters Grants Program and the Fire Prevention and Safety Grants Program

subsection.text: Section 33(r) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2229(r)) is amended by striking 2024 and inserting 2030.

Section 33(q)(1) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2229(q)(1)) is amended by striking to carry out this section— and all that follows through the fiscal year described in clause (i) and inserting to carry out this section $750,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2028.

section.header: Reauthorization of Staffing for Adequate Fire and Emergency Response Grant Program

subsection.text: Section 34(k) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2229a(k)) is amended by striking 2024 and inserting 2030.
Section 34(j)(1) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2229a(j)(1)(I)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (G), by inserting and after the semicolon;
in subparagraph (H), by striking fiscal year 2013; and and inserting each of fiscal years 2024 through 2028.; and

section.text: Not later than three years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall conduct an audit of and issue a publicly available report on—

paragraph.text: barriers that prevent fire departments from accessing Federal funds; and

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
